intro: Ruellia erecta, commonly known as the upright ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems and bloom during the summer months. Ruellia erecta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and relatively easy care requirements.
